Description: Weight: dīnār. Five line Kufic inscription within dotted border. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York, 27; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 45. Cf. Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 87-8; Fahmi 1957, 46.

All the illustrated specimens of dīnār weights with al-Qāsim's name alone are from the same die. Pieces on which al-Qāsim appears without an executive are normally to be dated to the earlier part of his period of office. The present type was presumably replaced by that issued 'at the hands of' Muslim b. al-ʿArrāf in 119.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (71)
